content.value: Managing files and directories is one of the most common tasks in Linux.
A file is a container used to store data such as text, images, or programs.
content.example: Example: notes.txt is a file and Documents is a directory.

content.value: A directory is a folder that holds files and other directories.
content.example: Example: notes.txt is a file and Documents is a directory.

content.value: touch is a command used to create an empty file or update the timestamp of an existing file.
content.example: Example: Creating a file named file1.txt.

content.value: mkdir (make directory) is a command used to create new directories.
content.example: Example: Creating a directory named projects.

content.value: cp (copy) is a command used to copy files and directories from one location to another.
content.example: Example: Copying file1.txt to another folder.
